snippet: After fleeing their homeland to escape war and Islamist extremism, many now find that their long trek to the Continent may offer no guarantee of protection.
abstract: Recent arrivals to Europe now worry about their safety with revelations that suspect in Paris terrorist attacks was using Syrian passport; even  before the violent siege, hundreds of thousands of asylums seekers arriving in European Union nations knew their welcome was wearing thin.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and KIMBERLY BRADLEY
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Kimberly Bradley from Vienna. Reporting was contributed by Barbara Surk from Ljubljana, Slovenia; Katarina Johannsen from Berlin; Matthew Brunwasser from Belgrade, Serbia; and Christian Haimet from Paris.

lead_paragraph: After fleeing their homeland to escape war and Islamist extremism, many now find that their long trek to the Continent may offer no guarantee of protection.

headline.main: Refugees Across Europe Fear Repercussions From Paris Attacks
headline.print_headline: After Fleeing Home, Still No Sense of Security

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
